course.subject: LANG
course.name: Laboratory Report Writing for Chemistry Students
course.description: This course focuses on developing Chemistry students' ability to produce effective laboratory reports with appropriate organizational structures, vocabulary, language and style. For CHEM students only.

reviews.author: helloworld
reviews.title: 垃圾course就唔好喺度為禍人間啦
reviews.comment_content:
同mc lab一齊take既lang course, suppose係教寫lab report, focus主要係introduction同results and discussion, 但教既人對science毫無認知, 再加埋根本現實中冇人會拎d類似 mc lab既實驗寫full report (都唔講mc lab d experimental design本身已經夠7), 結果就係讀完成個sem都唔知個course有咩意義

I now recap in English, damn useless course focusing on how to write up a report with data from a poorly designed experiment.
reviews.comment_teaching:
垃_圾

唔識chem我都忍到, 畢竟lang instructor冇話一定識major d野(講緊係連基本既scientific jargon都唔識果種), 但lang instructor連英文都寫唔好講唔好係咪有少少過份?

I now recap in English, how can an English teacher spell lab as 'lap' and write emails with numerous grammatical errors again and again?
reviews.comment_grading: 未出letter grade, 但應該唔會好, 出完再補
reviews.comment_workload:
1 cred, 成個sem上6堂+1 consultation(1 hr each)
intro (兩個人交一份)
full report (individual)

workload唔大，但完全唔知做黎有乜意義，浪費人生

reviews.author: Fickdeinemutter
reviews.title: Meaning of Its Existence Only Lies in Lifting My GPA
reviews.comment_content:
Teach you how to write “academic” English in a “science” way for constructing a “formal” lab report. The teaching went part by part according to the order of a “standard” lab report.

Only seven lessons to attend. The first six lessons were attended every week from the start of February to mid-March.

The last lesson was a consultation session scheduled in April, when you were expected to ask questions concerning the performance of your “lab report's introduction” submitted in early mid-March.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lessons were indescribably gibberish, as the skills of writing a “formal” lab report should have been acquired in high school when at least one SBA assignment of each science subject was lab report's writing.

The significance of this course is very low.

I would also attach an email from this course's tutor to show his English proficiency.

“Full Lap report feedback lang3012

Dear Students:

I hope you are going on well with your exam. You are going to receive two emails, including this one, about the scores of your full lap report submitted as your 2nd assignment. The score descriptor is attached here, which is the same as your canvas course website. You can refer to the descriptor for better understanding of your scores. The 2nd email is following this one.

The scores are not yet finalized and are subject to change in the panel meeting.

Tutor,

Jerry (WONG, Kai Hung)”
reviews.comment_grading:
Seven lessons as aforementioned. At least SIX have to be ATTENDED to PASS the course.

The experiment to be written on for the lab report would be given on Canvas.

Assignment 1, 25%: Introduction of Lab Report (can work in a pair or individually)
Assignment 2, 65%: Entire Lab Report (ONLY individual)
Participation, 10%: In-Class & Out-class

In-Class: Minimum Attendance  
Out-Class: Four Online Quizzes with Unlimited Attempts

My Final Grade: B-
Well, still acceptable.

reviews.author: EdogawaC
reviews.title: One of the BEST course taught by the BEST instructor!!!
reviews.comment_content: only 5 or 6 'normal' lessons, but contents taught are highly relevant. Basically covers the important aspects of writing a professional lab report: Intro, experimental, discussions and conclusion. Lecture materials are well designed and examples given are very helpful. Common language errors made by non-native speakers are highlighted, and I cannot stress how useful they are to improving my English, We also have two consultation sessions where we get feedback from our reports, and these are beneficial too.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Rebecca is an *outstanding* instructor, she really KNOWS how to teach, how to consolidate student's knowledge, how to engage the class and encourage discussion. She also highlights the common grammatical or colloquial mistakes that students in HK tend to make, and I find that so useful that when I take Lang 4012, I still refer to the lecture notes from this course. And the overall atmosphere was amazing, and lets face it, listening to perfect English by a native speaker is just amazing!!!
To me personally, Rebecca is the best instructor I have ever had!
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is fair, you put effort into your work, you will get good scores. 45% each for two reports, one is group of 2. Rest is from class participation.
For me, report 1 = 6.5/7/7, report 2 = 7/7/7. A+
reviews.comment_workload:
simply attend lectures and pay attention, complete the occasional homework and ask Reb if you have any questions, and you have a great course.
TLDR: virtually no workload except reports

reviews.author: Kxxx
reviews.comment_content:
5 normal lessons - covers how to write a different section of a lab report
Feedback class  - review feedback on report 1  
Consultation - small group consultation to discuss your draft of report 2

*Attendance* you must attend 6 out of the 7 face-to-face sessions in order to pass the course, regardless of your performance in the assessments.
reviews.comment_teaching: Rebecca showed many report examples in the class and reminded you all the  important points of the report.
reviews.comment_grading:
Preparation for the feedback class (5% of the course).
Preparation BEFORE this class involves making edits to report 1, based on feedback you have received.
Preparation for the consultation (5% of the course).
Preparation BEFORE this consultation involves identifying aspects of your draft for report 2 that you want to ask specific questions about, to help you improve the draft.


Report 1 : 6/6/5.5
Report 2 : 6/6.5/6

grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
only 2 reports are required
attendance is very important!!!
